Claim: Images of the medical facility shared with the claim that the Indian Army set up a 1,000-bed hospital in Rajasthan during the coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: Upon investigation, we found out that all the images were old and two of them were not even from India. One is from the US and another is from Germany. Even the Indian Army clarified on Twitter that such claims are baseless.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Images of the medical facility shared with the claim that the Indian Army set up a 1,000-bed hospital in Rajasthan during the coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:Upon investigation, we found out that all the images were old and two of them were not even from India. One is from the US and another is from Germany. Even the Indian Army clarified on Twitter that such claims are baseless.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/no-indian-army-did-build-1000-bed-hospital-in-two-days-for-in-rajasthan/

Claim: WHO director overstated COVID-19 fatality rate as higher than flu.
Explaination: CDC data and doctors said that coronavirus has much higher mortality rate than flu.
Label: False
html:
Claim: WHO director overstated COVID-19 fatality rate as higher than flu.

Explanation:CDC data and doctors said that coronavirus has much higher mortality rate than flu.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472001-Fact-Check-Evidence-Does-NOT-Show-The-WHO-Director-General-Overstated-COVID-19-Fatality-Rate.html

Claim: American fast-food chain Hardee’s is advising truckers to walk up to drive-thrus during coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: A spokesperson from CKE Restaurants said the company advises against walking up to drive-thrus for safety reasons.
Label: False
html:
Claim: American fast-food chain Hardee’s is advising truckers to walk up to drive-thrus during coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:A spokesperson from CKE Restaurants said the company advises against walking up to drive-thrus for safety reasons.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-hardees-is-not-advising-truckers-walk-up-to-drive-thrus-during-coronavirus-pandemic.html

Claim: Photos show a Chinese man eating “human baby soup” have circulated on social networking platforms. He is seen sitting at a table with a stillborn baby served in front of him.
Explaination: The photos were from a performance art show by Chinese artist Zhu Yu in 2000.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photos show a Chinese man eating “human baby soup” have circulated on social networking platforms. He is seen sitting at a table with a stillborn baby served in front of him.

Explanation:The photos were from a performance art show by Chinese artist Zhu Yu in 2000.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/251545-photos-chinese-man-having-human-baby-soup-improve-health

Claim: Chinese intelligence officer says the novel coronavirus as a biological weapon invented by China.
Explaination: The viral post also claims that the damage caused by the pandemic is being normalized by the Chinese officials. The website which has published the alleged testimony of the said Chinese intelligence officer has published the report with the headline, “CORONA UNMASKED: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals True Magnitude of China’s Fake “Coronavirus” Crisis – 包含中文字符版本”. The story published by the Reddit community No Sleep is just a horror story and does not have anything to do with reality. the community itself terms it as a storytelling platform and not a true story publisher.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese intelligence officer says the novel coronavirus as a biological weapon invented by China.

Explanation:The viral post also claims that the damage caused by the pandemic is being normalized by the Chinese officials. The website which has published the alleged testimony of the said Chinese intelligence officer has published the report with the headline, “CORONA UNMASKED: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals True Magnitude of China’s Fake “Coronavirus” Crisis – 包含中文字符版本”. The story published by the Reddit community No Sleep is just a horror story and does not have anything to do with reality. the community itself terms it as a storytelling platform and not a true story publisher.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15251863

Claim: A photo has been shared hundreds of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows coffins of coronavirus victims in Italy.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photo has circulated in media reports since 2009 about the coffins of earthquake victims in the Italian city of L'Aquila.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo has been shared hundreds of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows coffins of coronavirus victims in Italy.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photo has circulated in media reports since 2009 about the coffins of earthquake victims in the Italian city of L'Aquila.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-has-circulated-reports-about-coffins-earthquake-victims-italy-2009

Claim: Health care workers union “suddenly finds a stash of 39 million face masks.”
Explaination: Health care workers’ union launched a nationwide search on March 21 for face masks and other protective gear that have been in short supply since the COVID-19 pandemic swept across the U.S. On March 26, the union announced that it had found a supplier with 39 million masks.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Health care workers union “suddenly finds a stash of 39 million face masks.”

Explanation:Health care workers’ union launched a nationwide search on March 21 for face masks and other protective gear that have been in short supply since the COVID-19 pandemic swept across the U.S. On March 26, the union announced that it had found a supplier with 39 million masks.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/unions-search-for-face-masks-gets-twisted-online/

Claim: President Donald Trump’s statement that lupus patients are not vulnerable to COVID-19 is not true.
Explaination: Oskoui's remarks ignore the fact that lupus is an autoimmune disease, and people who suffer from it have increased chances of catching any infection, according to WebMD.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump’s statement that lupus patients are not vulnerable to COVID-19 is not true.

Explanation:Oskoui's remarks ignore the fact that lupus is an autoimmune disease, and people who suffer from it have increased chances of catching any infection, according to WebMD.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-trumps-statement-lupus-patients-are-note-vulnerable-to-coronavirus-are-not-medically-supported.html

Claim: Says it was “unquestionably” not within his “legal authority” to postpone Illinois’ primary election by changing the date or shifting to vote-by-mail.
Explaination: It’s difficult to know for sure that Pritzker could not have done anything to delay the March 17 election. But experts told us the governor spoke correctly in describing the limits of his powers under existing law.
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: Says it was “unquestionably” not within his “legal authority” to postpone Illinois’ primary election by changing the date or shifting to vote-by-mail.

Explanation:It’s difficult to know for sure that Pritzker could not have done anything to delay the March 17 election. But experts told us the governor spoke correctly in describing the limits of his powers under existing law.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/24/jb-pritzker/did-pritzker-lack-authority-postpone-illinois-prim/

Claim: Russian government has unleashed lions on the streets to impose a public curfew.
Explaination: The viral bulletin is digitally edited and the lion in the image was a part of a movie shoot from South Africa.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Russian government has unleashed lions on the streets to impose a public curfew.

Explanation:The viral bulletin is digitally edited and the lion in the image was a part of a movie shoot from South Africa.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/23/fact-check-putin-unleashed-lions-on-the-streets-of-russia-to-impose-public-curfew/

Claim: 23 new COVID-19 cases confirmed in Mombasa.
Explaination: The cases were not confirmed by Kenya's Ministry of Health.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 23 new COVID-19 cases confirmed in Mombasa.

Explanation:The cases were not confirmed by Kenya's Ministry of Health.

https://pesacheck.org/false-kenya-has-not-confirmed-23-covid-19-cases-in-mombasa-6ec3e146e6c5?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Posts shared thousands of times on Facebook claim to provide an emergency food stamp hotline.
Explaination: This is false; the phone number is not for the US Department of Agriculture, which is responsible for food stamps, and instead is a disconnected number formerly belonging to rapper Mike Jones.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Posts shared thousands of times on Facebook claim to provide an emergency food stamp hotline.

Explanation:This is false; the phone number is not for the US Department of Agriculture, which is responsible for food stamps, and instead is a disconnected number formerly belonging to rapper Mike Jones.

https://factcheck.afp.com/calling-number-will-not-get-you-food-aid-us?check=1

Claim: Trump said “people are dying who have never died before”.
Explaination: Searches in databases of the phrase never show up. Other fact checks confirm fabrication.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Trump said “people are dying who have never died before”.

Explanation:Searches in databases of the phrase never show up. Other fact checks confirm fabrication.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472012-fact-check-trump-did-not-say-people-are-dyng-who-have-never-died-before.html

Claim: Ireland is in the first phase of a lockdown sequence.
Explaination: Ireland has introduced measures to restrict the spread of COVID-19 but it is not a lockdown and there is no evidence to suggest that the government is considering a lockdown. The Irish PM has said that Ireland is following the South Korea model of social distancing, social isolation and contact tracing, and this does not include the locking down of the country.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Ireland is in the first phase of a lockdown sequence.

Explanation:Ireland has introduced measures to restrict the spread of COVID-19 but it is not a lockdown and there is no evidence to suggest that the government is considering a lockdown. The Irish PM has said that Ireland is following the South Korea model of social distancing, social isolation and contact tracing, and this does not include the locking down of the country.

https://www.thejournal.ie/ireland-lockdown-sequence-fact-check-debunked-5057514-Mar2020/

Claim: 10 coronavirus cases confirmed in Ecuador.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: 10 coronavirus cases confirmed in Ecuador.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/ecuador-10-casos-positivos-para-coronavirus/?fbclid=IwAR1i-e5y3cPTG5WPJhuipV9cA_Ly5vPlz2dBTtczgID5peTbenUb7B8gCEg

Claim: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra getting beaten up by police during the lockdown for stepping out of home.
Explaination: The man getting beaten up by police is not filmmaker Sudhir Mishra.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra getting beaten up by police during the lockdown for stepping out of home.

Explanation:The man getting beaten up by police is not filmmaker Sudhir Mishra.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-this-is-not-filmmaker-sudhir-mishra-getting-beaten-police-1661392-2020-03-30

Claim: Video shows reciting Namaaz and Quran is the only treatment for COVID-19.
Explaination: BOOM looked at the video and found several indications about it being a 'Viral Test', Aaj Tak's show where it debunks false claims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video shows reciting Namaaz and Quran is the only treatment for COVID-19.

Explanation:BOOM looked at the video and found several indications about it being a 'Viral Test', Aaj Tak's show where it debunks false claims.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/cropped-aaj-tak-video-used-to-spread-misinformation-on-coronavirus-7164?infinitescroll=1

Claim: Ads are selling masks protecting against COVID-19.
Explaination: US authorities don't recommend people to wear masks and the doctor does not speak about CoV.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Ads are selling masks protecting against COVID-19.

Explanation:US authorities don't recommend people to wear masks and the doctor does not speak about CoV.

https://factcheck.afp.com/coronavirus-protection-masks-hawked-misleading-video-ad-facebook

Claim: Amid the coronavirus pandemic, Health Minister of India is playing Ludo.
Explaination: The picture is almost one year old.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Amid the coronavirus pandemic, Health Minister of India is playing Ludo.

Explanation:The picture is almost one year old.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-union-minister-harshvardhan-playing-ludo-old-photo-viral-in-corona-situation-1-1176086.html

Claim: A purported warning from Australian hospitals has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook that using petrol pumps can enable the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health said it did not issue the purported advisory; scientists say the virus is unlikely to survive on petrol pumps outside as sunlight and lack of moisture generally kill it; motorists are advised to regularly wash their hands to avoid infection.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A purported warning from Australian hospitals has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook that using petrol pumps can enable the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health said it did not issue the purported advisory; scientists say the virus is unlikely to survive on petrol pumps outside as sunlight and lack of moisture generally kill it; motorists are advised to regularly wash their hands to avoid infection.

https://factcheck.afp.com/australias-department-health-did-not-issue-warning-using-petrol-pumps-can-spread-covid-19

Claim: Photos show animals returning to clear Venice canals.
Explaination: Yes, these photos of clear water in Venice are real. However, the Dolphins were not in Venice like one twitter user suggests.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Photos show animals returning to clear Venice canals.

Explanation:Yes, these photos of clear water in Venice are real. However, the Dolphins were not in Venice like one twitter user suggests.

https://youtu.be/1zh6KttN8AQ

Claim: Posting anything on coronavirus will be a punishable offense because the Disaster Management Act has been implemented.
Explaination: As per the Disaster Management Act, there is no provision that mentions that apart from government departments, no other citizen can be allowed to talk, update or share any news related to a disaster.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Posting anything on coronavirus will be a punishable offense because the Disaster Management Act has been implemented.

Explanation:As per the Disaster Management Act, there is no provision that mentions that apart from government departments, no other citizen can be allowed to talk, update or share any news related to a disaster.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/fake-message-on-disaster-management-act-says-posting-on-covid-19-illegal-fact-check

Claim: A “patient tested positive” for the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV) at the Makati Medical Center.
Explaination: There is still no confirmed case of the 2019 nCoV in the Philippines as of January 28, according to the Department of Health (DOH).
Label: False
html:
Claim: A “patient tested positive” for the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV) at the Makati Medical Center.

Explanation:There is still no confirmed case of the 2019 nCoV in the Philippines as of January 28, according to the Department of Health (DOH).

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/250336-patient-tested-positive-2019-ncov-makati-medical-center

Claim: “Hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus.”
Explaination: The Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “Hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus.”

Explanation:The Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/29/blog-posting/hair-extensions-arent-source-2019-coronavirus/?check=1

Claim: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government or he’ll infect others.
Explaination: Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatening to spread COVID-19 across Nigeria.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government or he’ll infect others.

Explanation:Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatening to spread COVID-19 across Nigeria.

https://factcheck.afp.com/story-originated-parody-account-no-driver-threatening-spread-covid-19-across-nigeria?check=1
